p: Similar to what was introduced during the 2002/2003 SARS-COV outbreak, a Chinese traditional medicine program challenged its experts with the development of preventive and treatment strategies for COVID-19. A similar global effort to introduce scientifically backed herbal remedies to combat COVID-19 alongside conventional treatment will prove helpful. Though these herbals are promising options in decreasing virion entry and the course of infection, caution must be established and tests must be conducted to avoid toxic and non-efficacious regimens. Undeniably, clinically proven therapeutics remain the gold standard for treatment. As such, efforts to engage preliminary and pre-clinically supported herbs of minimal side effects and cost with randomized controlled trials should be considered.
